column3: An accepted form of money, including coins and paper notes, which is generally issued by a government and circulated within an economy.

National currency (the currency or legal tender issued by a nation's central bank or monetary authority; the national currency of a nation is usually the predominant currency used for most financial transactions in that country according to ISOÂ 4217)
Legacy currency (national currency that ceased to be a legal tender)
Bullion coins (coins struck from precious metals and kept as a store of value or an investment, rather than used in day-to-day commerce)
